channel.title: Active Directory on Office 365 blog
channel.description: Recent content in Active Directory on Office 365 blog

item.title: Decrypting ADSync passwords - my journey into DPAPI
item.description: Microsoft changed the location of ADSync encryption keys in Azure AD Connect version 1.4.x. These keys are used to encrypt and decrypt the passwords of “service accounts” used for syncing data from AD to Azure AD. Earlier versions saved the keys in the registry, but currently, it is using DPAPI. Thus, AADInternals couldn’t decrypt the passwords anymore. Luckily, Dirk-jan Mollema described in his great article how the encryption keys could be extracted and used to decrypt the passwords. Using Dirk-jan’s article as a starting point, I decided to implement this to AADInternals.
